title: Angkor Wat
summary: Angkor Wat (/ˌæŋkɔːr ˈwɒt/; Khmer: អង្គរវត្ត, lit. 'temple city / city of temples'[2]), located in northwest Cambodia, is the largest religious structure in the form of a temple complex in the world by land area,[3] measuring 162.6 hectares (401+3⁄4 acres).[4] At the centre of the temple stands a quincunx of four towers surrounding a central spire that rises to a height of 65 m (213 ft) above the ground.[5] The temple has three rectangular galleries, each raised above the next. It lies within an outer wall 3.6 kilometres (2+1⁄4 miles) long and a moat more than five kilometres (three miles) long.[6]
